attributes.action: To change the unfair benefit system which in part, currently subsidises those who plot against our own Government and to deny the use of British taxpayers money for anti-British politicising.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Anjem Choudary – the extremist cleric who wanted to lead a protest march through Wootton Bassett, allegedly claims £25,740 from the British Taxpayer. He makes no apparent attempt to find work, and instead uses his time campaigning against our democracy and our Heritage, instead allegedly spending time in Radio and TV Studios and on the streets 'Rabble Rousing'. 
In contrast a frontline soldier, fighting Choudary’s alleged taliban allies in Afghanistan, takes home £17,004 for risking his life.
Should that soldier be killed in the line of duty, his widow would receive significantly less from the state than what Choudary currently receives.
This is just one example of Benefit abuse.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
